meanings.definition: Cowers (verb): to crouch down in fear
meanings.sent1: The small dog cowers when it hears thunder.
meanings.sent2: She cowers in the corner whenever there is a loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The cat cowers under the bed during a storm, thinking it's a giant game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The old tree cowers under the weight of the heavy snow, bending low to the ground.
meanings.sent5: The child cowers behind their parent, peeking out cautiously at the unfamiliar surroundings.

meanings.definition: Cowers (noun): a person who cowers in fear
meanings.sent1: The cowers in the story always seek safety in dark corners.
meanings.sent2: She saw a cowers in the haunted house, trembling with fear.
meanings.sent3: The cowers at the costume party wore a cloak and pretended to be a ghost.
meanings.sent4: In the movie, the cowers was portrayed as a timid character who overcame their fears.
meanings.sent5: The cowers in the fairy tale found courage in the face of danger and stood up to the villain.
